intro: Achillea halleri, commonly known as lesser yarrow, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in flat-topped clusters, and its leaves are typically gray-green with a woolly texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed areas. Achillea halleri is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used historically in herbal remedies.
